header.title: Statistics of the Westminster Leningrad Codex
header.description: Statistics of chapters, verses, characters, and verse XML tags in the WLC Tanach. Torah-only statistics are also given.

char.name: Zarqa
char.notes: This character is to be used when Zarqa or Tsinor are placed above, and also for Tsinorit.

char.name: Zinor
char.notes: This character is to be used when Zarqa or Tsinor are placed above left.

char.name: Patah
char.notes: Furtive patah is not a distinct character.

char.name: Holam
char.notes: OW is usually a holam vav with exceptions set by the Donnelly/Kirk algorithm.

char.name: Holam haser after vav
char.notes: WO is usually a vav holam-haser with exceptions set by the Donnelly/Kirk algorithm.

char.name: Meteg
char.notes: Maybe used as a Hebrew accent sof pasuq.Left (75), center (35), and right (95) metegs are separately grouped to produce correct positioning. The center meteg is preceded by a ZWJ, u200D, for positioning.

char.name: Maqaf
char.notes: An accent displayed in the Vowels content mode.

char.name: Paseq
char.notes: May be treated as spacing punctuation, not as a point. Each Paseq is preceded by a Space, \u0020, for positioning.

char.name: Sof Pasuq
char.notes: An accent displayed in the Vowels content mode.

specialchar.name: Slash
specialchar.notes: Morphological divider. Appears as ' ¦ ' in odt and pdf files.

specialchar.name: Zero width joiner (ZWJ)
specialchar.notes: Center meteg is a ZWJ + meteg.
